nl.cwi.java_managed_data.language.data_manager

Class BasicFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.cwi.java_managed_data.language.data_manager.BasicDataManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFactory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LockableFactory, ObservableFactory

    public class BasicFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFactory
    Represents the basic data manager.
    Author:
    Theologos Zacharopoulos

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicFactory

        public BasicFactory(java.lang.Class<?> moSchemaFactoryClass,
                    Schema schema,
                    java.lang.Class<?>... proxiedInterfaces)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        moSchemaFactoryClass - the Class of the Schema-Factory.
        schema - the schema of the managed object which will be built.
        proxiedInterfaces - (Optional) extra proxied Interfaces which will be attached to the Dynamic proxy of the managed object.

    • Method Detail

      • make

        public <T> T make()
        Used to build data managers which build managed objects. More specifically, it takes as an input the data manager, a factory class and a schema, the data manager interprets the schema, and returns a Proxied Factory that creates Managed Objects which are described with that schema.
        Specified by:
        make in interface IFactory
        Returns:
        a new factory which creates managed objects.

      • createProxiedManagedObject

        protected java.lang.Object createProxiedManagedObject(java.lang.Class<?> moSchemaFactoryClass,
                                                      Schema schema,
                                                      java.lang.reflect.Method schemaFactoryCallingMethod,
                                                      java.lang.Object... inits)
        Proxies a managed object. The reason of using a proxy here is to add methods on the returned object since Java does not support dynamic method attachment.
        Parameters:
        moSchemaFactoryClass - the Class of the Schema-Factory.
        schema - the schema of the managed object which will be built.
        schemaFactoryCallingMethod - the method that is called to the schema factory in order to create a managed object instance.
        inits - (Optional) a list of initialization props for the object construction.
        Returns:
        a new Proxied ManagedObject.

      • createManagedObject

        protected MObject createManagedObject(Klass klass,
                                      java.lang.Object... inits)
        This method should be implemented from the derived data manager in order to create specific Managed Objects.
        Parameters:
        klass - the Managed Object schema Klass
        inits - a list of initialized props for the object construction.
        Returns:
        a new Managed Object.

      • addProxiedInterface

        private void addProxiedInterface(java.lang.Class<?> newInterface)
        Helper to add new proxied interfaces, this is needed in case we need a new interface to be proxied on the Managed Object.
        Parameters:
        newInterface - the interface to be added in the proxied interfaces list.
